problem.markdown:
>>Broadly speaking, what are good uses of problems in a learning sequence?<<
[x] To deliver information in a more active way. [x] To assess student performance. (formative assessment) [x] To give students a means to construct information for themselves, rather than telling them. (constructive learning) [x] To allow students to practice concepts they are learning. (active learning) [x] To give students a tool to monitor their own level of progress and mastery. (metacognition) [x] To allow students to quickly figure out whether they already know the material, so they can skip watching tedious videos or reading text. (improve efficacy)
problem.p: Broadly speaking, what are good uses of problems in a learning sequence?

checkboxgroup.label: What's a good use of problems in a learning sequence?
checkboxgroup.choice: To deliver information in a more active way.
To give students a means to construct information for themselves, rather than telling them. (constructive learning)
To allow students to practice concepts they are learning. (active learning)
To give students a tool to monitor their own level of progress and mastery. (metacognition)
To allow students to quickly figure out whether they already know the material, so they can skip watching tedious videos or reading text. (improve efficacy)
